metadata.title: CVE-2022-38177 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
By spoofing the target resolver with responses that have a malformed ECDSAsignature, an attacker can trigger a small memory leak. It is possible togradually erode available memory to the point where named crashes for lackof resources.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
bind9-host - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
bind9utils - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
dnsutils - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libbind9-160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libdns-export1100 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libdns1100 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libirs-export160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libirs160 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libisc-export169 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
libisc169 - 1:9.11.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1.18
